result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Nunn Curry II

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Nunn Curry II not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Benjamin Nunn Curry II.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant entered a speedy trial demand.
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-9-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 12-12-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Nunn Curry II appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Benjamin Nunn Curry II.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status following 22CF2810. Matter is adjourned to the trial court.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Nunn Curry II in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mallory R Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for defense motion to modify bail. Arguments heard.  Court denied defense request to modify bail.  Case is adjourned to 9-27-22 at 1:30 pm in Preliminary Hearing Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Nunn Curry II appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Benjamin Nunn Curry II.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #22CF2810.  Sworn for the State: DA Investigator M. Wilkerson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense requests to be heard on bail. Case is adjourned to Branch 10.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Amount: $20.00
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Benjamin N. Curry II, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter
Letter from defendant.  (Benjamin Nunn Curry II - #2022008785, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Per an email from ADA Zyber "investigator is unavailable" for the next court date of 8/29/22 at 1:30pm. Defense counsel has not yet been appointed. Next date will be 9/12/2022 at 1:30pm for a preliminary hearing.

Defendant Benjamin Nunn Curry not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with RJW (DOB: 11/17/1996)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Benjamin Nunn Curry in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Benjamin Nunn Curry in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin Nunn Curry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br 10.
